intro: Lardizabala infusiata, commonly known as the Andean mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers, which bloom in the early morning and close by midday. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing seeds. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
